title: 1909-11 Hindu (brown) T206 Cy Young for SALE - Price Lowered AGAIN!!!
author: 68Hawk

posts.post_title: 1909-11 Hindu (brown) T206 Cy Young for SALE - Price Lowered AGAIN!!!
posts.post_content:
Price well below it's purchase price of 5 years ago......$1500 will now buy this terrific card!!!

1909-11 Hindu (Brown) T206 Cy Young Portrait SGC Auth, terrific card with the rarer Brown Hindu back, graded accurately for rear surface wear. Front presents vg-ex with no creases or wrinkles, strong color and perfect focus. Back shows small peel removing the 'I' and 'N' from Hindu, most likely from removal from a scrap book. Interestingly, this card also has a stamp to the back, seemingly placed there by an early owner......I'm unable to be confident in the script but would make a good who dunnit for the next owner! 
Sorry about the lack of focus from my scanner, card has crisp registration focus.

This card last sold in 2011 Goodwins Auctions for $1655
$1500 price includes fully insured delivery. Payment by paypal preferred

[IMG]http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad12/flinchfree/sports%20cards%20and%20memorabilia/1909-11%20T206%20Hindu%20Cy%20Young%20Portrait%20SGC%20Auth_zpshhumkmgi.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad12/flinchfree/sports%20cards%20and%20memorabilia/1909-11%20T206%20Hindu%20Cy%20Young%20Portrait%20back%20SGC%20Auth_zps6nfmbgle.jpg[/IMG]

At the risk of hijacking your thread, I hope you don't mind my posting a little info about the stamp. A board member has put together this very cool site and this stamp is listed on it:

[url]http://thegreatt206backstampproject.yolasite.com/leo-amiss-bros.php[/url]

Nice card, good luck with the sale.
That's brilliant Brian, thanks for the link to the extra back stamp gallery!!!

For any considering if this card would cross to PSA, a little history on the card....
I purchased it at auction from Goodwins Auctions in 2011, for $1655 including the juice.  Here is the link:  [url]http://www.goodwinandco.com/LotDetail.aspx?inventoryid=17214[/url]

It resided in a PSA 1 (MK) holder, which I crossed over to SGC. All my prewar are in SGC holders. SGC felt the rear paper pull too significant to give anything other than an Auth, which I agree with, however should you wish to cross it back to PSA I believe you would be successful.

[IMG]http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad12/flinchfree/sports%20cards%20and%20memorabilia/T206%20Hindu%20Cy%20Young%20PSA1%20MK_zpskvrwatig.jpeg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i917.photobucket.com/albums/ad12/flinchfree/sports%20cards%20and%20memorabilia/T206%20Hindu%20Cy%20Young%20PSA1%20MK%20back_zpswwusrxwe.jpeg[/IMG]

Card now available on eBay for $1525.

Will remain for sale on BST unless a bid is received on ebay, but any genuine interest must be received before the last 24 hours of the ebay auction listing expires so that it can be withdrawn for private sale.
Great card, will go to Auction house if not sold soon....
